hillbillies.model

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Activity.Unit

  • public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    The unit class, this class keeps tracks of the unit's position, speed and other attributes. It provides methods to move, to attack or to rest.
    Invariants:
  • The position of the unit must be valid.
        isValidPosition(this.getPosition())
  • The orientation fof the unit must be valid.
        isValidOrientation(this.getOrientation())
  • The weight of the unit must be valid.
        canHaveAsWeight(this.getWeight())
  • The Strength of the unit must be valid.
        isValidStrength(this.getStrength())
  • The Agility of the unit must be valid.
        isValidAgility(this.getAgility())
  • The Agility of the unit must be valid.
        isValidAgility(this.getAgility())
  • The Toughness of the unit must be valid.
        isValidToughness(this.getToughness())
  • The HitPoints must be valid.
        canHaveAsHitPoints(this.getHitPoints())
  • The stamina must be valid.
        canHaveAsStamina(this.getStamina())

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        @Raw
public Unit(java.lang.String name,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int z,
                  int weight,
                  int strength,
                  int agility,
                  int toughness)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new unit with the given position.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new unit.
        x - The initial x value of the position.
        y - The initial y value of the position.
        z - The initial z value of the position.
        weight - The initial weight of the unit.
        strength - The initial strength of the unit.
        agility - The initial agility of the unit.
        toughness - The initial toughness of the unit.
        Postconditions:
      • If the given strength is less then 25 then the initial strength is set to 25. If the given strength is more then 100 then the initial strength is set to 100. Otherwise the initial strength is set to the given strength.
            if strength > 100
            then new.getStrength() == 100
            else if strength < 25
            then new.getStrength() == 25
            else new.getStrength() == strength
      • If the given agility is less then 25 then the initial agility is set to 25. If the given agility is more then 100 then the initial agility is set to 100. Otherwise the initial agility is set to the given agility.
            if agility > 100
            then new.getAgility() == 100
            else if agility < 25
            then new.getAgility() == 25
            else new.getAgility() == agility
      • If the given weight is less then 25 then the initial weight is set to 25. If the given weight is more then 100 then the initial weight is set to 100. Otherwise the initial weight is set to the given weight.
            if weight > 100
            then new.getWeight() == 100
            else if weight < 25
            then new.getWeight() == 25
            else new.getWeight() == weight
      • If the given toughness is less then 25 then the initial toughness is set to 25. If the given toughness is more then 100 then the initial toughness is set to 100. Otherwise the initial toughness is set to the given toughness.
            if toughness > 100
            then new.getToughness() == 100
            else if toughness < 25
            then new.getToughness() == 25
            else new.getToughness() == toughness
      • Sets the hit points to their maximum value.
            new.getHitPoints() == new.getMaxPoints()
            && new.getStamina() == new.getMaxPoints()
        • Effects:
      • Set the name to the given name.
            setName(name)
      • Set the position to the middle of the given block.
            setPosition(x + Lc/2, y + Lc/2, z + Lc/2)
      • Sets the orientation to 90 degrees.
            setOrientation(Math.PI/2)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • advanceTime

        public void advanceTime(double dt)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Updates the units state.
        Parameters:
        dt - The time step taken between frames.
        Postconditions:
      • If the unit is moving then: 1: If the unit is sprinting the unit's stamina is decreased with one: 1.1: if the stamina timer is smaller than 0, the unit's stamina is decreased with 1. 1.2: if the unit's stamina is zero, the unit stops sprinting. 2: If the unit isn't sprinting and the default behaviour is enabled, the unit has a small change to start sprinting. 3: The next position is calculated as position + v*dt. 4: If the next position is further away from the target neighbour the unit has arrived and the unit's position is set to the position of the target neighbour. 3.1: If we have a pendingActivity we switch to that activity. 3.2: If the unit is at the target or the unit has no other target, the unit stops moving. 3.3: Otherwise the unit moves to the next neighbour. 5: Otherwise we set the position to the next position.
      • If the unit is working then the workTimer is decreased. If the work timer has run the unit stops working.
      • If the unit is attacking another unit the attackTimer is decreased, if it runs out the other unit has to defend and the unit stops attacking.
      • If the unit is resting, the restTimer is decreased. If the timer runs out the timer is first reset. If the unit can heal HP, we heal HP otherwise the unit heals stamina, if neither can be increased the unit stops resting.
      • If the unit is currently not conducting an activity, the unit continues an interrupted activity if it exists. If it doesn't exist and the default behaviour is enabled, we choose an activity at random.
      • We also check if three minutes have past, if so we start resting and reset this timer.
        • Effects:
      • Stops sprinting if the unit's stamina is depleted or if the unit arrived at the target. Also starts sprinting randomly when default behavior is enabled. setSprint()
      • If the unit passes the centre of the target neighbouring cube this dt, the position of the unit is set to the centre of this neighbouring cube. setPosition()
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given time step was to big or negative.

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(double x,
                                      double y,
                                      double z)
        Checks whether the given position is valid.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the unit's position.
        y - The y value of the unit's position.
        z - The z value of the unit's position.
        Returns:
        True if the given position is within the boundaries of the world.
            result == ((x >= 0) && (x < X_MAX) && (y >= 0) && (y < Y_MAX) && (z >= 0) && (z < Z_MAX))

      • isValidPosition

        public static boolean isValidPosition(double[] position)
        Checks whether the given position is valid and effective.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the position is effective, has 3 components and is within bounds.
            result == isEffectivePosition(position) && isValidPosition(position[0], position[1], position[2])

      • isEffectivePosition

        public static boolean isEffectivePosition(double[] position)
        Checks whether the given position is effective.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the position is effective and the length is 3.
            result == position != null && position.length == 3

      • setPosition

        @Raw
public void setPosition(double x,
                              double y,
                              double z)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the position of the unit.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the new position.
        y - The y value of the new position.
        z - The z value of the new position.
        Postcondition:
        The new position of this unit is equal to the given position.
            new.getPosition()[0] == x &&
            new.getPosition()[1] == y &&
            new.getPosition()[2] == z
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given position is not valid. | !isValidPosition(x, y, z)

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the position of the unit.
        Parameters:
        position - The new position as an array.
        Effect:
        The new position of this unit is equal to the given position.
            this.setPosition(position[0], position[1], position[2])
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given position is not effective. | !isEffectivePosition(position)

      • getCubePosition

        public static int[] getCubePosition(double[] position)
        Returns the coordinates of the cube that the unit currently occupies.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be converted.
        Returns:
        Returns the rounded down position.
            result[0] == floor(position[0]) &&
            result[1] == floor(position[1]) &&
            result[2] == floor(position[2]}

      • isValidName

        public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the name is valid.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if name is at least 2 characters long, starts with an uppercase letter and contains only letters, spaces and quotes.
            result == (name.length() > 2) && name.matches("[A-Z][a-zA-Z'\" ]*")

        @Raw
public void setName(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the name of the unit.

        Postcondition:
        The new name is the given name.
            new.getName() == name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The name is not valid. | !isValidName(name)

      • canHaveAsWeight

        public boolean canHaveAsWeight(int weight)
        Returns whether or not the weight is valid.
        Parameters:
        weight - The weight to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the weight is larger or equal to MIN_ATTRIBUTE, larger or equal to (strength + agility)/2, smaller or equal to MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            result ==  (weight >= MIN_ATTRIBUTE) && (weight <= MAX_ATTRIBUTE) && (weight >= (getAgility()+getStrength())/2)

      • getWeight

        @Basic
public int getWeight()
        Returns the weight of the unit.

      • setWeight

        @Raw
public void setWeight(int weight)
        Sets the units weight to the new weight.
        Parameters:
        weight - The new weight.
        Postcondition:
        If the weight is less then (strength+agility)/2, it's set to this value.
            if weight < (this.strength + this.agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (this.strength + this.agility)/2           Otherwise if the weight is more then MAX_ATTRIBUTE, it's set to MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            if weight > MAX_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getWeight() == MAX_ATTRIBUTE           If the weight is still less than MIN_ATTRIBUTE, it's set to MIN_ATTRIBUTE.
            if weight < MIN_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getWeight == min(1, (this.strength + this.agility)/2)           Otherwise the weight is set to the given weight.
            else new.getWeight() == weight

      • isValidStrength

        public static boolean isValidStrength(int strength)
        Returns whether the strength is valid.
        Parameters:
        strength - The strength to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the strength is larger or equal to MIN_ATTRIBUTE and smaller or equal to MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            result == strength <= MAX_ATTRIBUTE && strength >= MIN_ATTRIBUTE

      • getStrength

        @Basic
public int getStrength()
        Returns the strength of the unit.

      • setStrength

        @Raw
public void setStrength(int strength)
        Sets the strength of the unit.
        Parameters:
        strength - The new strength for the unit.
        Postconditions:
      • If the given strength is less than MIN_ATTRIBUTE, the new strength is MIN_ATTRIBUTE.
            if strength < MIN_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getStrength() == MIN_ATTRIBUTE           If the given strength is more then MAX_ATTRIBUTE, the new strength is MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            else if strength > MAX_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getStrength() == MAX_ATTRIBUTE           Otherwise the new strength is the given strength
            else new.getStrength() == strength
      • The weight is adapted to match the new strength.
            if this.getWeight < (strength + this.agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (strength + this.agility)/2
            else new.getWeight() == this.getWeight()

        @Raw
public void setAgility(int agility)

        Postconditions:

            if agility < MIN_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getAgility() == MIN_ATTRIBUTE           If the given agility is more then MAX_ATTRIBUTE, the new agility is MAX_ATTRIBUTE.
            else if agility > MAX_ATTRIBUTE
            then new.getAgility() == MAX_ATTRIBUTE           Otherwise the new agility is the given agility.
            else new.getAgility() == agility
      • The weight is adapted to match the new agility.
            if this.getWeight < (this.strength + agility)/2
            then new.getWeight() == (this.strength + agility)/2
            else new.getWeight() == this.getWeight()

      • canHaveAsHitPoints

        public boolean canHaveAsHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Returns whether the hitPoints are valid.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The hit points to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the hitPoints are larger than or equal to 0 and smaller than or equal to the maximum amount of hitPoints.
            result == (hitPoints <= getMaxPoints()) && (hitPoints >= 0)

      • getHitPoints

        @Basic
public int getHitPoints()
        Returns the current amount of hitPoints of the unit

      • setHitPoints

        @Raw
public void setHitPoints(int hitPoints)
        Sets the current hitPoints to the given amount of hitPoints.
        Parameters:
        hitPoints - The new hitPoints of the unit.
        Precondition:
        The hitPoints must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max hitPoints.
            (hitPoints <= getMaxPoints()) && (hitPoints >= 0)
        Postcondition:
        The new hitPoints equal the given hitPoints.
            new.getHitPoints() == hitPoints

      • canHaveAsStamina

        public boolean canHaveAsStamina(int stamina)
        Returns whether the stamina is valid.
        Parameters:
        stamina - The stamina to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the amount of stamina is larger than or equal to 0 and smaller than or equal to the maximum amount of hitPoints.
            result == (stamina <= getMaxPoints()) && (stamina >= 0)

      • setStamina

        @Raw
public void setStamina(int stamina)
        Sets the current amount of stamina to the given stamina.
        Parameters:
        stamina - The new amount of stamina of the unit
        Precondition:
        The stamina must be greater or equal than 0 and smaller or equal than max stamina
            (stamina <= getMaxPoints()) && (stamina >= 0)
        Postcondition:
        The new stamina equals the given stamina.
            new.getStamina() == stamina

      • getMaxPoints

        public int getMaxPoints()
        Return the maximum amount of hitPoints and stamina.
        Returns:
        Returns 200*(weight/100)*(toughness/100) as an integer
            result == ceil(200*weight*toughness/10000)

      • isValidOrientation

        public static boolean isValidOrientation(double orientation)
        Returns whether the orientation is valid.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation to be verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the orientation is equal to or larger than 0 and smaller than 2*PI
            result == (orientation < 2*Math.PI) && (orientation >= 0)

      • getOrientation

        @Basic
public double getOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation.

      • setOrientation

        @Raw
public void setOrientation(double orientation)
        Sets the orientation of the unit.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The new orientation.
        Postcondition:
        The new orientation is the same as the old orientation but between 0 and 2*PI.
            new.getOrientation() == ((2*Math.PI) + (orientation % (2*Math.PI))) % 2* Math.PI

      • isMoving

        @Basic
public boolean isMoving()
        Returns True if the unit is moving.

      • moveToAdjacent

        public void moveToAdjacent(int dx,
                           int dy,
                           int dz)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts the unit moving towards one of the adjacent cubes.
        Parameters:
        dx - the x direction
        dy - the y direction
        dz - the z direction
        Postconditions:
      • The unit will be moving
            new.isMoving() == True
      • The unit will move to the target when calling advanceTime()
            new.getPosition[0] == old.getPosition[0] + dx &&
            new.getPosition[1] == old.getPosition[1] + dy &&
            new.getPosition[2] == old.getPosition[2] + dz
        • Effect:
        Set the unit's orientation
            setOrientation(Math.atan2(getSpeed().getY(), getSpeed().getX()));
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the target cube is not within the world bounds | !isValidPosition(this.getPosition()[0] + dx,this.getPosition()[1] + dy,this.getPosition()[2] + dz)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the dx, dy or dz values aren't -1, 0 or +1 | Math.abs(dx) > 1 || Math.abs(dy) > 1 || Math.abs(dz) > 1
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the unit can't move right now | !canHaveAsActivity(Activity.MOVE)

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(int[] target)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts the units movement to the given target cube.
        Parameters:
        target - The coordinates of the target cubes.
        Postconditions:
      • The unit starts moving.
            new.isMoving() == true
      • The unit will move to the target when calling advanceTime().
            new.getPosition == target.add(Lc/2)
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given target is not valid. | !isValidPosition(target[0], target[1], target[2])
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the unit can't move. | !this.canHaveAsActivity(Activity.MOVE)

      • getSpeedScalar

        public double getSpeedScalar()
        Gets the units movement speed.
        Returns:
        Returns the base speed if the unit is moving and not sprinting. Returns 0 if the unit is not moving. Returns twice the base speed if the unit is sprinting.
            if (getSpeed() != null && !isSprinting())
              then result == getSpeed
            if (getSpeed() == null)
              then result == 0
            if (getSpeed() != null && isSprinting())
              then result == 2 * getSpeed

      • setSprint

        public void setSprint(boolean sprint)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Enables or disables sprint mode for this unit.
        Parameters:
        sprint - Declares if the unit wants to sprint or stop sprinting.
        Postcondition:
        Sets whether the unit is sprinting or not.
            new.isSprinting == sprint
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws if the unit wants to sprint and the unit has no stamina or the unit is not moving. | sprint && (getStamina() == 0 || !isMoving())

      • isDefending

        @Basic
public boolean isDefending()
        Returns True if the unit is defending.

      • attack

        public void attack(Unit other)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Attacks an other unit.
        Parameters:
        other - The unit that is attacked by this unit.
        Postconditions:
      • Makes the other unit defend.
            (new other).isDefending == True
      • Makes the units look at each other.
            new.getOrientation() == atan2((other.getPosition[1] - this.getPosition[1]),
                  (other.getPosition[0] - this.getPosition[0]))
            (new other).getOrientation() == atan2((this.getPosition[1] - other.getPosition[1]),
                  (this.getPosition[0] - other.getPosition[0]))
      • Makes the unit attack.
            new.isAttacking == True
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws if the other unit is null or if the unit tries to attack itself. | (other == null || other == this)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws if the unit can't attack. | !canHaveAsActivity(Activity.ATTACK)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws if the other unit is not in attack range. | ( (abs(this.getPosition[0] - other.getPosition[0])) > 1 || | ( (abs(this.getPosition[1] - other.getPosition[1])) > 1 || | ( (abs(this.getPosition[2] - other.getPosition[2])) > 1 )

      • isResting

public boolean isResting()
        Returns True if the unit is resting.

      • rest

        public void rest()
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Starts resting.
        Postconditions:
      • If the unit is not resting then reset the rest state.
            if !old.isResting
            then new.initialRest == true && new.restDiff == 0
      • The unit is resting.
            new.isResting() == true
        • Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws if the unit is moving. | this.isMoving()

      • startDefaultBehaviour

        public void startDefaultBehaviour()
        Starts the default behavior.
        Postcondition:
        The default behavior is enabled.
            new.isDefaultEnabled == True

      • stopDefaultBehaviour

        public void stopDefaultBehaviour()
        Stops the default behavior.
        Postcondition:
        The default behavior has stopped.
            new.isDefaultEnabled == False

      • isDefaultEnabled

        @Basic
public boolean isDefaultEnabled()
        True if the default behaviour is enabled.
